intro: Quamoclit pennata, commonly known as the featherleaf quillwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves that are typically arranged in a whorl pattern around the stem. The plant thrives in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into aquatic fruits. Quamoclit pennata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
